definition: to touch/(fig.) to touch on (a matter)
to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions

sentences.english: It is a building that you cannot touch.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个你不能触碰的建筑。

sentences.english: I represent to you all the sins you have never had the courage to commit.
sentences.chinese: 我向你们展示所有你们从不敢触碰的罪。

sentences.english: The world of dreams is a network of Cape and distant, although cannot touch.
sentences.chinese: 梦的彼岸就是网络里的海角和天涯，虽不能触碰。

sentences.english: 9A Greenland sled dog pup touches his mother's nose in Qeqertarsuaq, Greenland, on July 21, 2011.
sentences.chinese: 一只格陵兰的拉雪橇的小狗触碰母亲的鼻子。

sentences.english: Is unhappy, is also not warm, may also move that Daoguang.
sentences.chinese: 不欢乐，也不热烈，也可以触碰那道光。

sentences.english: The sensation is a burn like touching a hot stove or an iron.
sentences.chinese: 感觉就像是触碰炉子或热铁块那样的灼烧感。

sentences.english: That was its devine touch made it possible.
sentences.chinese: 冥冥中注定的那次触碰让这成为可能。

sentences.english: After breaking up missing so pain, pain to even memories are afraid to touch.
sentences.chinese: 分手后的思念那么痛，痛到连回忆都不敢触碰。

sentences.english: Clean the glass with wipes and sop up the water with a towel, do not touch the bulb.
sentences.chinese: 用百洁布清洁玻璃板，切勿让湿的百洁布触碰灯泡。

sentences.english: If the touch early warning line, export pace easily remind sellers adjust replenishment.
sentences.chinese: 倘若触碰预警线，出口易会提醒卖家调整补货步调。

sentences.english: Other males started touching the eggs.
sentences.chinese: 其他的雄鱼也开始触碰这些卵。

sentences.english: Touch the person lightly on the arm or shoulder when you're talking.
sentences.chinese: 当你们在谈论时，轻轻地触碰他人的手臂或者肩膀。

sentences.english: The expedition team did not interfere with the remains, taking only photographs.
sentences.chinese: 探险队没有随便触碰这些遗迹，只是拍摄了照片。

sentences.english: Such technology could allow users to command a computer without touching it.
sentences.chinese: 这种技术可以让用户不需要触碰电脑就能控制它。

sentences.english: Then he saw a student was going to touch a red button on the instrument.
sentences.chinese: 他看见一个学生正要触碰仪器上面的一个红色按钮。

definition: to touch (physically, one's feelings etc)/to touch on (a topic)
to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions
to gently caress and stroke/to pet/to fondle
to touch/to stir up (trouble or emotions)/to move (sb's emotions or worry)
to stir/to prod/to poke/to move sideways/to strum (on a guitar etc)
to press close to/to snuggle close/intimate
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract
